# cell(withTag:)

**Instance Method**

Searches the receiver and returns the last cell matching the specified tag.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func cell(withTag tag: Int) -> NSCell?
```

## Parameters

- **tag**: The tag of the cell to return.

## Return Value

The last (when viewing the matrix as a row-ordered array) [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell] object that has a tag matching `anInt`, or `nil` if no such cell exists

## Related Documentation

- **selectCell(withTag:)**: Selects the last cell with the given tag.
- **tag**: Returns the receiver’s tag.

## Finding Cells

- **selectedCells**: An array containing all of the matrix’s highlighted cells plus its selected cell.
- **selectedColumn**: The column number of the selected cell.
- **selectedRow**: The row number of the selected cell.
- **cell(atRow:column:)**: Returns the cell at the specified row and column.
- **cells**: An array containing the cells of the matrix.
